txt.en: 'Ha! Oh my!'

'Finally! I have to say, [placeholder], I am not sure how all these stairs fit inside the farmhouse. It looked quite a bit smaller on the outside, didn't it?

'A pox on ghosts and spectres! Why can't things be just as they appear?

'I suppose we have to keep going. Maybe the next trick will be that this spooky building is actually not as scary or as haunted as it appears? Here's hoping!'
'They mocked him. They insulted him.'
The door on the west side of the farmhouse is unlocked and will take you and Dinodas into the cellar beneath the farmhouse.
'A job well done!'
'I suppose we have to keep going, [placeholder]?'
'His rage and his hate drew me here.'
You have come with Dinodas to the haunted farmhouse at Eerie Acres, and the two of you should make your way through the cellar to uncover its secrets.
'He died in this very chair, and no one wept for him.'
'No! No! Stop this nonsense at once!'
DNT - Blah!
'Enough!'
DNT - Blah!
'This changes nothing.'
'Halson Cleary was hated by his neighbours.'
Talk to Dinodas among the misty trees
'They whispered cruel things about him, and they let him die.'
'His rage drew me here!'
Check the front of the farmhouse
'So?'
Check behind the farmhouse
Bingo and his cousins have come to the main room of the old Cleary farmhouse, willing to stand with you against the Skulking Ire!
Check the west side of the farmhouse
DNT - Blah!
Check the east side of the farmhouse
Bingo and his cousins have come to the main room of the old Cleary farmhouse, willing to stand with you against the mysterious spirit... but will it be enough to oppose the fiend's malice?
DNT - Blah!
Bingo has given you the only weapons that might harm the Skulking Ire: the letters Ivy Redsmith wrote to Halson Cleary so long ago.
There is something most peculiar about these stairs...
The Skulking Ire rages within the old Cleary farmhouse.
'What does it matter, hole-dweller?'
Bingo is within the old Cleary farmhouse.
'I say it was not!'
'Are you not afraid of me?'
DNT - Blah!
Dinodas is within the old Cleary farmhouse.
'This does not change anything. Halson Cleary died.'
'He died alone, with only me for company.'
'Stay back!'
The door is locked and barred, and cannot be opened from this side
'Leave me be!'
Skulking Ire
Talk to Dinodas by the cellar door
'Bah!'
Open the door on the west side of the farmhouse and enter the cellar
Make your way through the haunted farmhouse with Dinodas
'That'll teach him, and no mistake!'
Make your way into the main room of the farmhouse
'You can't frighten us!'
The forest encroaches upon the rear of the farmhouse
Help Dinodas withstand the fear that threatens to overpower him
The door to the cellar appears to be unlocked
'I have! Such spirits make the land more like themselves, just by being there!'
No one now rests upon this side porch, if anyone ever did

'I did some thinking, [placeholder], and I decided I could not let you and young Dinodas face this danger alone! So I set my misgivings aside and prepared to follow the two of you, and don't you know it but my other cousins had much the same idea!\n\n'Something about this spirit's story strikes me as quite suspicious. I think we should get to the bottom of it, and at once!'
'What did you say your name was? The Skulking Ire?'
'You're more like a Skulking Liar!'
'I'm not? I'm not!'

'The Skulking Ire is defeated, [placeholder]! He won't be bothering us anymore, not if he knows what's good for him! Now that he is gone, I expect hobbits at Wistmead will no longer feel the effect of his presence. It is not soon enough, if you ask me, but better late than not at all!

'I wish we could have done more to help Halson Cleary. His is a sad story, and while I am glad to have at last put an end to the villainy of the Skulking Ire, we are much too late to help poor departed Mr. Cleary. Better late than never, did I say? It is hard to be later than this, two hundred years gone, but still I hope he finds some rest in it.

'I should like to make arrangements to bury him. I shall inquire with the Mayor, and perhaps the Quick Post can be made to foot the bill; had they delivered Ivy Redsmith's letters, some measure of pain might have been avoided! No, I will not judge postmasters long-gone. The Skulking Ire had a hand in the dereliction of their duties.

'I think Halson Cleary should like to be buried in his garden. We will set Ivy's letters with him, and may he find peace at last with the memory of her.'
'And take your curse with you!'

'Did you see that, [placeholder]? Skulking Liar, I called him! Oh, if only Celandine had been here to see my incredible bravery and courage! You'll tell her, won't you?

'It's funny. I was frightened when we came to the forest, and then again when we arrived at the spooky farmhouse hidden within. I was beside myself with terror when you told me the door to the cellar was unlocked. And each new vision we beheld as we made our way through the Cleary farmhouse increased my horror tenfold!

'But when it came right down to it, when we confronted the spectre and so many of my brothers and sisters were beside me... well, things didn't seem quite as scary anymore. How very strange! Even so, I look around me now and the spookiness begins to creep back and I tell you I am ready to go! Yes, let's leave while we have the opportunity, [placeholder]! Brrrr! What's the hold-up?'
'Who has disturbed my vigil?'
'Let's go, [placeholder].'
'The faster we move, the sooner we're done with this!'
'Shunned by my neighbours...'
'Did you hear that? Oh, maybe it was my imagination.'
'Left alone...'
'Is that... a farmhouse?'
'Left to die...'
'It looks like no one has lived here for a long time.'
'The time has come to levy my curse upon them!'
'You'd better check it out, [placeholder]. I'll wait here.'
'You are well-read for one of the hole-dwellers.'
'What did you find over here, [placeholder]?'
'I am the Skulking Ire, and I speak for he who no longer can.'
'Oh. A cellar door. Brrrr!'
'Halson Cleary died years ago, hated by his neighbours.'
'They called him eerie, and off-putting, and strange.'
Halson Cleary?

If the ghost of Halson Cleary is really to blame for the haunting of Wistmead and the Curse of the Eerie Acres, Bingo is certain that you and his cousin Dinodas will be able to get to the bottom of it.
You have finally arrived at the main room of the haunted farmhouse.
You have come to the main room of the old Cleary farmhouse with Dinodas Boffin, and must not give in to the fear that threatens to overwhelm the young hobbit.
'Oh, I do not like this...'
'Oh no! What... what is this?'
'Can it be? It's Green-eyes... from the scary story!'
'He is gone, thank goodness! And now we should go too... onward, I guess!'
'Oh, now what? Do you hear that?'
'Longo Proudfoot... trapped in his larder! What a terrible fate!'
'Will that happen to us, [placeholder]? Will we be trapped here forever?'
'Oh dearie me! We cannot think like that, but must push ahead anyway!'
'I hope that is the last frightening thing we will see here!'
Follow Dinodas through the spooky forest
DNT - LANDING ONE
DNT - LANDING TWO
DNT - LANDING THREE
'Is this... is this the top? It had... it had better be!'
DNT - LANDING FOUR
There is something peculiar about these stairs
'Stop right there!'
'I don't believe you are Halson Cleary at all.'
'I have read a number of scary stories to celebrate the season...'
'...and that is simply not how otherworldly spirits behave!'
'No, you are something else.'
'I think you will find us quite a surprising folk!'
'You are wrong, spirit!'
'You say Halson Cleary had no friends?'
'I have proof that says otherwise!'
Instance: None But One
'You tell him, Dino!'
'Yes!'
'Ooooh, I don't like this, [placeholder].'
Skulking Liar
'A sudden gust of wind!'
'My torch went out!'
'Hullo?'
'Are you awake, sir?'
'Well, go on then, spirit! Let's see what terrible vision you have for us!'
'Oh dear! I think this fellow is dead!'
'Nothing, eh? Ha!'
'Is this... is this Halson Cleary?'
'I think we may be through the worst of it, [placeholder].'
'Oh my!'
'This house must have already run out of frights for us. Ha!'
'Are you... are you the ghost of Halson Cleary?'
'I charge forward with newfound courage!'
'Hmm, another door.'
'After you, [placeholder].'
'Stairs? Ah, you can go ahead, [placeholder].'
'I will catch my breath and meet you at the top.'
'[placeholder]! Catch!'
'The Long Winter had been like none the Shire had ever seen.'
'Hobbits died of hunger and cold, even among their friends and their families.'
'Ivy Redsmith wanted to help Halson Cleary but the Winter prevented it.'
'That's a good one!'
'Yes, you said.'
'Ha ha!'
'I have been thinking about that.'
'There are places in the world where evil spirits dwell.'
'I don't like this one bit, [placeholder]!'
'Marigold has told me quite a lot about some of them.'
'I don't see anything out of the ordinary now...'
'You strike me as a Barrow-downs sort of chap.'
'These fish are not REALLY here, are they?'
'I think you left the Barrow-downs and settled here at Cleary's Acres.'
'This reminds me of that scary story... the one with Odo Grubb! It sends a shiver down my spine!'
'Brrrrr! This otherworldly sight sends a shiver down my spine!'
'It is gone, just like the others. Let us keep going, [placeholder]!'
'Oh no! What is this?'
'What new horror waits for us ahead?'
'What manner of cellar is this? It is unlike any I have seen!'
'I feel eyes upon us, [placeholder]! Eyes... right here!'
'But I think you came here BEFORE you say you did.'
'It matters.'
'That's the way, Dino!'
'It matters because I think it was your presence that caused Halson's neighbours to dislike him.'
'And don't come back!'
Talk to Bingo in the haunted farmhouse
'You arrived and Halson's neighbours felt uneasy.'
'They knew something was not quite right about Cleary's Acres.'
Stand with Bingo as he confronts the mysterious spirit
'But they didn't know what it was.'
'It was you. It was you the whole time.'
At long last: deliver the mail ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
'He did. Knowing this won't bring him back.'
Confront the Skulking Ire with Bingo and the other Boffins
'But if I could tell him that he was missed, I would.'
Talk to Bingo inside the old Cleary farmhouse
'I would tell him that even when he felt most alone, there were still hobbits who cared.'
Reinforcements have arrived: a whole brood of Boffins!
Bingo tosses a satchel of envelopes to you, and you grab it from the air!
'Did Halson think you were a friend?'
Talk to Dinodas inside the old Cleary farmhouse
'Did he suspect you were to blame for his solitude?'
'No. I think you are the one who needs to leave!'
'Hobbits won't fall for your tricks any longer!'

'This was a bad idea, and I regret it already! Let's turn around and tell Bingo we didn't find anything. What do you say, [placeholder]?

'I know he's depending on us, but he doesn't have all the information, does he? He thinks I don't believe in ghosts, and not only that: he thinks that will be an advantage to us on this endeavour. But he's mistaken! Won't my belief in haunts and spectres and ghostly apparitions serve as an even worse disadvantage?

'Oh, harrumph, fine! We can keep going. But I am not happy about it, not happy about it at all!'
You have come with Dinodas Boffin into the misty woods that border Wistmead in search of the spirit that troubles the Shire.

'Well, the door to the cellar is locked, so I guess we'd better turn around and go back home...\n\n'What's that? The door is unlocked? Oh dear, oh dear. There could be anything lurking down there, [placeholder]! Do we really have to go down there?'
You and Dinodas have found a dilapidated farmhouse in the middle of the misty forest. Can these be the Eerie Acres of which the specter spoke?
Dinodas is looking at the cellar door on the west side of the farmhouse.
